This is the newest ride from Navee that has been going for $1,500 since its release in early November, though it starts off higher from $1,600 at Amazon. Despite this higher starting rate, we’ve only seen one previous discount coming from its Amazon storefront, which dropped costs to $1,400 mid-December. Now, you can score an even larger $200 markdown off the going rate that lands it at a new all-time low price.

While it carries a $2,599 MSRP, you’ll more often find it starting as high as $1,699 at Amazon, with this same rate having been carried over from sale to sale since Black Friday. items.title: Lectric’s extended Holiday Sale returns up to $583 FREE bundles to the XPeak 2.0 off-road e-bikes from $1,499, more
items.summary:
Lectric eBikes has extended its Holiday e-bike sale for an unknown amount of time longer, but will most likely continue into the new year. Many of the previous deals with up to $893 bundle savings are available, though two of the three models with price cuts have returned to their usual bundle pricing, like the XPeak 2.0 Long-Range Off-Road e-bike and a FREE $583 accessory package at $1,699 shipped. You can also find the standard XPeak 2.0 e-bike with a FREE $434 bundle at $1,499 shipped. These bundles with their e-bikes would normally run you $2,282 and $1,933 at full price, which is not only bringing back Black Friday’s same offers, but also gives you another shot at the largest bundles we’ve seen to date.
